title: Cathepsin C is critical for the release of other cathepsins from lysosomes in leucyl-leucine methyl ester-triggered apoptosis

author: Nežka Kavčič, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: Well, hello.
I hope you're ready for another 3 minute jump into cell biology.
So.
Do you remember what cell is anything from your biology lessons in primary or secondary school?
Yeah, recall.
So one of the definitions is actually that the cell is the basic structural, functional and biological units of all known organisms.
So really small thing.
And it constantly struggles to stay alive.
However, all the good things come to an end and also sell dice, and so far there were discribed many pathways or many mechanisms how the cell dies.
We can see it.
Here and one of the best known mechanism is also self suicide, known also as a pop ptosis.
So during our experiments we work with cells and you can imagine here.
So this is the new close like Control Center.
All the brain of the cell we see mitochondria like energy factories and also we have lysosomes, lysosomes.
You can imagine them as tiny membraneous bags which have acidic pH.
And they have many.
They contain many digestive.
Enzymes to degrade bigger molecules of food and many other things.
So we have used Leo Man, which is a lysosomal detergent.
That means that it's specific for lysosomes and was able to to increase the pH in ourselves.
We can see here in the first step and in the second step it was able to permeabilize lysosomal membrane and consequently all the digestive enzymes were released into the cytosol.
So into the interior of the cell.
This could resemble to the stomach rupture or something like that.
That's quite unpleasant.
However, at the final step, the all these digestive enzymes actually stimulated the specific mechanism that caused cell death or cell suicide.
So during our work we were actually able to determine how these lysosomal detergent leoma actually works, and we have also.
Characterized which enzymes or digestive proteins were actually able to or responsible in each step of this process.
So at the.
I would like to acknowledge my mentor, Professor Boris took my close coworkers Miha and Barbara and other.
Colleagues from B1 Department.
So if you have any other questions I would be pleased if you ask me anything at the poster #60.
Otherwise I would like to leave the podium to next speaker rock package.
Who will guide us through the robotics world.
